text: we can no longer tolerate these chronic
trade abuses and we will not tolerate
them one of the things Donald Trump
always said he was going to kill off
were big multilateral trade deals
specifically the trans-pacific
partnership agreement or the TPP as it's
also known he did pull the u.s. out and
given the fact that America was the
biggest economy in the deal many thought
the TPP would die it did it the 11 other
countries in the agreement decided to
push ahead without the u.s. in it in
fact the u.s. looks like it could be the
one losing out geopolitically at least
as the rest of the world carries on the
u.s. still buys more from Asia than it
sells and Donald Trump's answer to this
has been to renegotiate or initiate
bilateral trade deals with individual
Asian countries he's in the process of
renegotiating one deal and that's the
u.s. South Korea agreement but that's it
for now China another big target of
trumps trade rage he said he was going
to call China a currency manipulator on
his first day in office and slapped
tariffs on Chinese goods coming into the
u.s. he didn't but we have seen moves
from the u.s. to keep Chinese companies
out of the United States and he's made
some headway in getting US financial
firms more access to the Chinese market
trade they have taken our money they
have taken our jobs Japan South Bank
said it was going to create 50,000 new
jobs in the US China's Alibaba said it
was going to create a million new jobs
in the US no concrete action on either
front so far but Trump did put enough
pressure on Japanese carmaker Toyota to
make it promise that it was going to
build one factory in the US which would
create some 4,000 jobs
Donald Trump hasn't been as tough on
trade in Asia as he had promised to be
but what he's clearly done is
drastically changed the direction of
America's trade policy very obviously
putting America first while there's been
a lot of rhetoric though there hasn't
been much in the way of concrete deals
or action so it's still quite doubtful
whether his strategy will push America
first or end up leaving America behind
